pullRequest.body:
During the port we found that `FunLike` is robust enough not to need an extra `CoeFun` shortcut. Let's see if that rule can be consistently applied to the whole of the library.

There is still duplication between `FunLike` and `CoeFun` for `Grp`, `Mon`, `CommGrp` and `CommMon`, which will need a more thorough fix. See also https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17866.

There is also a shortcut instance that we need for speed reasons: `SemilinearIsometry.instCoeFun`. I don't know why this is so performance-sensitive but the benchmarks tell us that it is.

See also #17871 for removing porting notes and comments where this change happened earlier on.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: !bench

### PR summary [abd00d72e4](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17870/commits/abd00d72e430f865107c3c1005a28abafe268abf)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`- instCoeFun`
`- instance : CoeFun (Π₀ i, β i) fun _ => ∀ i, β i`
`- instance {μ : YoungDiagram} : CoeFun (SemistandardYoungTableau μ) fun _ ↦ ℕ → ℕ → ℕ`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

:v: Vierkantor can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/b2d045d3-1e82-4574-8a7f-72d948a8b363) for commit 36f0ed359e338ed501e43b1ed1f4e1bca61e3f4b.
The entire run failed.
Found no significant differences.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/8a9e90ac-25bb-4cff-a678-6d023d2bc81e) for commit f28c9f594e560dc60de153d4d5b5f1cc99d4cadb.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/f808cb01-5564-48ab-a64b-ddb6b2cd313c/to/8a9e90ac-25bb-4cff-a678-6d023d2bc81e) against commit dc528566839d9a65fe7c84f2c6d2fb17bb49ecbc:
```diff
  Benchmark                                     Metric         Change
  ===================================================================
- ~Mathlib.Analysis.InnerProductSpace.Adjoint   instructions     8.4%
```

Not sure why that one file is so much slower: I didn't touch anything involving `LinearMap` or `ContinuousLinearMap` which seem to be the only types of maps that I can find in that file. If there's no simple explanation, I'm willing to eat the slowdown in exchange for cleaner code.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/1a3875ac-0c32-4b3f-b574-57a516fed195) for commit ae8a2bd7ff9d9bcfe3fe8bfbbb3d229e08e7f664.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/f808cb01-5564-48ab-a64b-ddb6b2cd313c/to/1a3875ac-0c32-4b3f-b574-57a516fed195) against commit dc528566839d9a65fe7c84f2c6d2fb17bb49ecbc:
```diff
  Benchmark                                     Metric         Change
  ===================================================================
- ~Mathlib.Analysis.InnerProductSpace.Adjoint   instructions     8.6%
```
Hmm. Binary search to see which subset of lemmas breaks the bench?
See #17921 for the benchmarks proving that `SemilinearIsometry.instCoeFun` is to blame for the slowdown.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/5cc8a716-3b0d-4e39-add3-22aeedbc0eb0) for commit abd00d72e430f865107c3c1005a28abafe268abf.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/7ff7c70d-c7e3-488f-92ab-c9935c174018/to/5cc8a716-3b0d-4e39-add3-22aeedbc0eb0) against commit ff1b88672d4e66db5195c5c57684e4081fab209f.

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11453281204/job/31865503960)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11453281204/job/31865504148)

Thanks :tada: 

If CI passes, please remove the label `awaiting-CI` and merge this yourself, by adding a comment `bors r+`.

bors d+
